ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Question about using seeds as SURT prefixes
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Adam, It would be fairly easy to transform the seeds into the surt directives. Maybe something like (linux cmdline): cat seeds.txt | perl -pe

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Question about using seeds as SURT prefixes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137477665; y=7HwxcrzAHx31oQWj54RLWK83ZfquE6qVBV0YIptwQDJTy0DpGQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: iranitovic

Hi Adam,

It would be fairly easy to transform the seeds into the surt directives.

Maybe something like (linux cmdline):

cat seeds.txt | perl -pe 's@^https?://www\.@+@' > surts.txt

Of course you can also remove wwwN if you want. If seeds have path, you 
can remove those as well and etc.

In general, if you know that you want to crawl all of your seeds in 
domain scope try using OnDomainsDecideRule.

Hope this helps.
Take care,
i.


astar_t wrote:
> Hi, I am using Heritrix 1.12.1 and I'm taking the default approach of
> using seeds as SURTs.
> 
> Here is an example seed list:
> 
> # start of seed list
> http://site-a.ca
> http://site-b.ca
> # ... etc ...
> 
> The above obviously will crawl everything on site-a.ca and site-b.ca
> AND all their subdomains.
> 
> This usually works fine but for some of my seeds the lookup fails if I
> don't also have the www in the seed.  So I would rather change my seed
> list to this:
> 
> http://www.site-a.ca
> http://www.site-b.ca
> 
> BUT this now means I will now not get the subdomains like
> subdomain.site-a.ca.
> 
> So to fix this I figure I need to change it to this:
> 
> http://www.site-a.ca
> http://www.site-b.ca
> +site-a.ca
> +site-b.ca
> 
> This is pretty long winded especially with 1000s of seeds.  Is there a
> better solution?  Is it possible somehow to have seeds with www at the
> start but make it so the www is ignored when translating it to a SURT
> form (without having to change to an OnDomains decide rule) ?  
> 
> Thanks!
> 
> Adam
> 
> 
> 
>  
> Yahoo! Groups Links
> 
> 
>
